name: Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Great hotel in a great location. Perfect for families with young kids, as the enclosed Kuhio beach is directly across the street. Extremely friendly and accomodating staff. Two convenience stores within the hotel which for families is fantastic! Also has various other shops, Coffee place, Hertz rent-a car, two pools and numerous other facilities within the hotel. so convenient. Everything is within walking distance, yet far enough away that it's not too chaotic and crowded. The beds are to die for. We also liked the daily 'free' kids activities within the hotel. We will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel!
Paradise
reviews.text: I’ve just returned from staying at the fabulous Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa! The hotel and the surroundings are lovely, cascading waterfalls in the lobby. You are less than five minutes away from Waikiki Beach but how cares, don’t let this put you off!! The hotel rooms are fine and the bed was the softest that I had ever slept in! The concierge can arrange all your trips, restaurants are on site what more could you ask for?!

reviews.title: A Great Stay For Us!
reviews.text: I would recommend you stay at this hotel!

reviews.title: Waikiki Marriott- A Nice high rise across from the beach
reviews.text: Just got back from a week at the Marriott Waikiki. We had a Deluxe Ocean View Room that was terrific. Check in was smooth and the daily housekeeping was top notch. The parking lot was pretty hairy because it was small and narrow. It also cost $14.00 a day to park there. We had some family functions to attend so we had to rent a car but, unless you are there for business or personal business, save some money by not renting a car. There are shuttles available for just about any activity or shopping venue on the island including the swap meet at the stadium. If you are looking to for the best prices on hawaii clothing, the swap meet is the way to go.
We attended the Germaine's Luau which was so-so, way too commercialized and the food was just ok. They did take good care of my brother-in law who is wheelchair bound.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nicely situated on the East end of Waikiki beach, away from most of the chaos, but still only a few blocks from restaurants and shopping. Across the street from the beach, nice rooms, friendly staff, and great pool bar.
reviews.title: Excellent value in prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a "premium" oceanview room. The room was very large and well-appointed. HUGE lanai (balcony), with two chairs, cocktail table and lounge chair. Plenty of room to spread out and fantastic views of the ocean and mountain side. Only complaint is that walls are a little thin. We had loud neighbors on our first night and had to bang on the wall to get them to quiet down. Otherwise, I was very impressed with the quality of the property.
reviews.title: better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They upgraded our room from cityview to partial ocean view without asking, very happy about that. Room was spacious. Very happy with service. Beds were very comfortable. A little noisy but what do you expect at Waikiki? Great hotel in Waikiki.
reviews.title: good place to lern about waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers good quality. We arrived early in the morning. But there was no problem for them to do the check in for us. we got a wonderfull room in the 16. floor and had an interesting view on the town and the mountains. For the beach view you had to pay more. The Kuhio Grill Restaurant in the hotel is perfect. It offers good quality. We went there for the bufett. Good value for the money.
reviews.title: Average Joe Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Waikiki is a beach ares like Palma de Mallorca in Spain/Europe. So there are better beaches on Oahu than the Wikiki beaches. There are lots of tourists so the room for the towels are small. But good to surf or to look on surfers. A lot of shopping is possible. there are good Restaurants arround. One new:Tne japanese restaurant Makittii, 2380 Kuhio Ave, with excellent food.
reviews.title: Don't bother - look elsewhere.

reviews.text: went there for a quick trip to attend uh manoa's family/homecoming weekend and the hotel was amazing...the ocean view from the room was amazing, the service from the staff was great and they were very helpful, for being such a huge hotel (takes up the whole block) it never seemed too busy and the pool area had plenty of chairs to relax, the italian place is amazing, will stay here again, nice walk to the beach across the street in a less busy beach area of waikiki
reviews.title: Amazing Location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location on Wakiki and close to a lot of attractions. The hotel is a bit dated and is in need of an update to be what I expect from a Marriott facility. That being said the staff was nice and courteous and the hotel had most amenities that I would expect. I will stay here again in the future but will definitely consider other properties depending on price and amenities.
reviews.title: Good hotel on Wakiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is definitely in a great location as everyone has said. We stayed here for 1 night only (just before our cruise) so my review is quite limited on this hotel. My first impression is that it is dated but so are most hotels in this area, I would say it is on the better side of dated. Friendly staff, very nice balcony looking out to the ocean. If you are on the NCL cruise they do have a great service in the lobby with their own NCL office but note that you had to have booked the cruise with NCL to use the service of checking in with them and them handling your luggage, we used a travel agent so we were unable to use this service but nevertheless they were very friendly and helpful about questions for the cruise. As one reviewer mentioned there are homeless in the area but we were not bothered by it. It is always disturbing to see this but it is a big city, so unfortunately it exists. Now would I return to this hotel? Maybe depending on the price.
reviews.title: Good for a few days but not a week

reviews.text: This hotel is exactly what you would expect from a Marriott. It was clean, comfortable and our view of Diamond head was beautiful. The pool areas and hottub are perfect. The beach is across the street. You are at the end of the strip of Waikiki Beach which is perfect because it is quieter. We had a late flight leaving the hotel and they held our bags for us and gave us a key to the hospitality suite. It was perfect to shower and get ready for our long flight home. We could not have been happier with this hotel. Also all of the buses and trolleys stop very close by.
reviews.title: Wonderful beack location

reviews.text: I've stayed here before, but I wasn't disappointed upon my return. I was booked in a premium ocean view, when entering my room I discovered the ocean wasn't visible from the room itself but from the lanai. Which is being realistic, the common misconception is that travelers book an ocean view expecting to see it from their room. If that's what you're looking for you'll need to pony up more dough and book an ocean front. The rooms were refurbished a few years ago with warmer red and orange tones. The beds replaced with their revitalize beds, as comfy as your own bed at home! It's a fantastic location, just steps away from Waikiki beach on the far end near the Honolulu Zoo. The hotel staff was very warm even though I had a long line to wait in for check in. It's also in a great location for those of you who are Catholic, there is the St. Augustine By The Sea church right next door! Wasn't my first visit and won't be my last!
reviews.title: Paradise close to the beach!

reviews.text: Our family of five had a one week vacation at this hotel in September. The hotel was relatively quiet, only one-third occupied. We didn't ask for an upgrade, being Australian, but after reading other reviews, perhaps we should have. I did request to be in the building closer to the beach which we found very convenient given we had a fair bit to lug to the beach each day. One of the reasons we chose the Marriott was for the pools but found we really didn't use them as the beach was so much better. Who wants to use a pool on a building anyway? The beds really were as comfortable as everyone is saying. My only complaint was the size of the bathrooms. We have stayed in a lot of hotels over the years but these bathrooms (we had two adjoining rooms) were miniscule. The POV was quite good but probably better on the Waikiki side and the breakfast package saved us heaps. The kids loved the waffles. The Marriott was certainly at the quieter end of Waikiki and we found the beach outside the Sheraton Moana to be our favourite spot which was probably a 10 minute walk from the Marriott. We spent the days swimming and touring around the Island and loved browsing the shops in the evenings. Great holiday, one week was plenty as we then had a fabulous week in Maui and I would recommend the Marriott although I would probably stay elsewhere if there is ever a next time as we love to try new places.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with very comfortable beds
best beds!!!
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, good location, Softest beds we have ever encountered. Attentive staff.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel-Except for the Lifts
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriot from the 9/28-10/1. Had a partial ocean view room which was great. The beds are fantastic, the kids didn't want to get out of bed because they were so comfortable!! Great Location across from the beach but the kids loved the 2 pools better. Staff in all areas of the hotel were excellent. Couldn't ask for better service. BUT the Lifts were a disaster. Took us just over 10 minutes to get down for breakfast twice. Rang up the lobby and told them that we have been waiting for quite a while, we had to go down via the service lift. 5 Elevators but only a couple seemed to be in operation. But apart from that, a great choice to stay in a Wonderful Place. Mahalo

reviews.title: Best hotel in Waikiki
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights 2 weeks ago.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: Booked a panoramic ocean view room and it was fantastic. The room was huge, 2 spacious lanai's. Very clean. Lovely bathroom, sofa, 2 queen beds, it was just perfect!

reviews.title: Great Family Hotel in, nice access to Family friendly things...
reviews.text: Hello, the family and I (2 kids- 3 y/o and 2y/o) spent a week at this hotel during a big conference. I really enjoyed this hotel and will outline the details for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overview: This is a very big hotel located at the far end of Waikiki. It is composed of 2 big towers. The hotel has some nice restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Great Location, Outdated Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: I liked the location even though it was exactly in the middle of Waikiki. You have easy access to Highway 1. It is very close to the Zoo, the beach, and the international marketplace. The downside was that it was across town from the Convention center (where meeting was held). People also don't like the fact that it is across the street from the beach. To be honest, we really never went to Waikiki Beach. We found a way better beach (see tip).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price: My company paid for this trip so I was really never concerned about the cost. We got a 2 double beds for $259 a night.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.text: Service: I really liked the service. Everyone was friendly (maybe just a hawaii thing). We asked for a crib and microwave and it was both delivered to our room in a timely fashion. Housekeeping was always quick to bring up more towels as needed.
reviews.title: Nice Overnight Stay

reviews.text: First of all, this hotel is NOT on the beach like the pictures make it out to be. We stayed in the older tower closer to the water than the other and it was tidy but not "clean". The walls were thin and I could hear my neighbors as they could probably hear me. There was also a festival going on that was very loud in addition to the band playing until all hours next door. I would say it would be good for business travelers, but not if you want to get any sleep or have to drive anywhere. The only good thing is the convenient location of a Pete's Coffee and Tea. I needed it!
reviews.title: Are you kidding me?

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Marriott's Waikiki Beach Resort. We were upgraded from a city view to an Ocean and Diamond Head view. It was just breath taking. The rooms themselves are very nice with very comfy beds, like sleeping on a cloud. Everyone we encountered that worked in the hotel from the housekeepers to the front desk we so friendly. We were in walking distance to resturants, the beach and lots of shopping. The hotel has 2 pools the front pool is just great with bar and food service all day. The back tower pool has no services.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort April 17-24!!!!

reviews.text: We ate dinner in the Kuhio Grill if you go before 6:30 on Friday nights for $24.95 there is a Prime Rib and Crab Leg Buffet all you can eat. The sweetest Crab Legs I've eaten. They also have great desserts.
reviews.title: Marriott Waikiki a Great Choice!!!
Beautiful rooms and view, would definetly go back
reviews.text: I highly recommend a stay.........

Having traveled quite a bit recently, I was anxious to see if the Waikiki Marriott would live up to my expectations or, as so many other hotels have in the past, left me wondering where all the good stuff in the brochure went off to!
reviews.title: Really loved the Marriott Waikiki!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriott Waikiki for 9 nights with my husband and adult son. We booked a corner ocean view room to ensure having extra space for 3 adults.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, a little too far away

likes.disliked: — Too far away from the centre of the tourist area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was of a good size, but only had 2 double beds instead of the 2 queen beds the site advertised.
reviews.title: Much better than I thought

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was tiny for a 4 star hotel room. The shower is over the bathtub but it had good water pressure and an easy to operate tap system. The toilet and bath are seperated from the vanity basin area by a door. The vanity is a single sink with ample bench space but the whole concept could certainly benefit from modernisation.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel for couples or families.

likes.liked: — Good location, good price and very friendly staff.

reviews.text: Cupboard space was very limited with several of the drawers under the tv unit being so shallow as to be useless.
reviews.title: Ideal in many ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping always did a great job of cleaning the room and were very flexible in waiting for us to leave the room at our leisure.
reviews.title: Great Resort Hotel on Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of a special annivesary, we booked the Waikiki Marriott with rewards points. We booked a standard city view with a queen sized bed and upon arrival were upgraded to a partial oceanview king, which was quite large. It has a desk area, chair, closet, refrigerator, a large balcony with two chairs and a chaise.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

likes.disliked: — Small pools, could have more daily activities

reviews.text: The Marriott appears to be recently remodeled but the furniture is not modern, it's more of a throwback tribute to old Hawaii. We still enjoyed it though.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Marriott

likes.liked: — Enough good pillows, room location, housekeeping service, tea/coffee provision.
likes.disliked: — Doors slammed closed, no one asked us if we needed help with our bags after check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The customer service was great. Again, we had the upgrade. I'm not sure if it's because of my marriott rewards status or the annivesary or both. They also gave us free drink tickets as a congratulations.
reviews.title: Recommendation: Look Elsewhere for Special Occasions

likes.liked: — The price was affordable compared to other hotels in the area.
likes.disliked: — Everything. The hotel operations are not running optimally.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are rather small and not very impressive, but you've got the beach right across the street. We had a wonderful dinner at the steakhouse there at the hotel. We enjoyed a very generous buffet with everything from crab legs to lamb at another restaurant at the hotel. And we dined poolside. Don't get the pizza! My husband didn't like it and they gave him another meal for free and didn't charge him for the pizza.
reviews.title: loved this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had wonderful massages at the spa. The gym is a good size. We planned to use it but caught vacation fever. :-)
reviews.title: A wonderful resort

likes.disliked: — Expensive for food,internet service and parking. No shuttle service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel 4/20-4/22. We have booked city view since it was the cheapest, but upon arrival we were upgraded to the ocean view because we are platinum members. They gave us a free breakfast coupon, but only for one person??? Room needs some major cleaning including huge stains on carpet and furniture. Bathroom light switch is sticky and so is hair dryer- yuck.....
reviews.title: Needs some cleaning..

reviews.text: This hotel has a such high volume because of location, so we think that the management doesn't care about upgrading/remodeling. It is very sad hotel that needs major revamp and more staff to take care of all guests.
reviews.title: Great Location with Great Rooms

reviews.text: We had two rooms, one in each tower, that were great rooms. Both had great views. We had a balcony with a great view of Diamond Head. The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly. We used the hotel concierge to get a great deal on Marriott's Ko'Olina Luau. The best luau we have ever been to prior to or since. The location is very central to everything. We will stay here again when in Honolulu.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family have always stayed at Marriott's because of the customer service and knowing you can always expect the same in all of the Marriott's. They do have high standards but not sure what happened to the Marriott in Waikiki i?? It was nothing like any others. The customer service was awful except for housekeeping. The staff acted as if we were bothering them when asking a specific question.I suppose they would need a new GM of the hotel and then clean house. I would not recommend this Marriott to anyone. Also when the balcony door is open it gets very noisy. Not a quiet place to be. Also the massage therapist would not listen to my concerns. I wanted a deep tissue and she insisted on a regular and just would not listen. Waste of a lot of money! Stay somewhere else like the Sheraton down the road.
reviews.title: A little old, but still good

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in an ocean view room. ocean view actual meant looking at the hotel opposite from the room with only an ocean view standing on the lanai. Room was a little dated, but everything worked okay. Breakfast was excellent and the staff serving were friendly and helpful. Location was right on Waikiki. Big gripe was that Internet access was either $14.95 per day (ridiculous in this day and age) and their 'free' wireless only available in the lobby did not work..even the staff failed to get it working. Note that free Internet was available from the hotel opposite in my room...just needed to be on the lanai to receive! Lastly room cost is over priced given the age and lack of free Internet. Also, noise from Tiki Bar next door ran to midnight and beyond despite being on 18th floor.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love staying at the Marriott Resort and Spa in Waikiki. It has a nice location whether you want to go for a run around Diamond Head, dine at nearby restaurants in the heart of Waikiki or hit the beach. The people are always quite friendly and the rooms are in good condition.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value, and Close to Everything

reviews.text: This was our second stay at this hotel and it's still a good place to stay. First visit was in August 2007 with my husband, parents, and niece (10) and nephew(6). The second visit was in September 2011 with my husband and 2.5 year old daughter.
reviews.title: Good location and value

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, bathroom is okay (a bit small), location is good that it's close to the beach but not too close to all the noise that occurs during the night if staying near the center of the strip. There's clothing stores, restaurants, and 2 ABC stores within the complex in case you need anything. No free wif-fi in the rooms, although free in the lobby but with lots of traffic connection can get slow.
reviews.title: Lovely room, most comfy bed ever!

reviews.text: We didn't go to the pool but since the beach was so close by, it was perfect. The beach is in the protected area so it's great for little kids. The beach has an outdoor shower to clean up. However with little kids, it's also nice to be able to just walk over to the hotel and clean up afterwards instead of putting them in the car or stroller. My daughter was happy to play in the sand for hours at a time...one day we were there from 9am to 1pm.
reviews.title: service not Marriott standard

reviews.text: We also had a 10pm flight out so we originally booked one extra night even though we were only going to stay til about 7pm. However we found out after we got there that it's only about $70 dollars to extend our stay til 6pm instead of paying for the extra night.
reviews.title: Decent Stay
Loved the Marriott
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott for three nights in Sept 04. It was fabulous. The beds were so comfortable, we are going to call them and see what linens and down comforters they use. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking is a bit much but there is really no where else to park in Waikiki that is cheaper. The hotel is in a great location, we walked up and down the strip every day.

reviews.title: Very Good Stay
reviews.text: The breakfast at their restaurant is a little pricey but very good. The Tiki Bar & Grill across the street is awesome. One of our best meals on Oahu & Maui. Duke's was also great and so was Cheeseburgers in Paradise (although service was a little on the slooow side).

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: After reading reviews on here I was hoping we would get upgraded to a full ocean view (we had a partial ocean view in the back tower), however she told me it would be an extra $30 per night. Needless to say the view was still great and we would definately stay there again.

reviews.title: Marriott nice, Wakkiki average, Volcano and Pearl Harbour Great!
reviews.text: You can't go wrong with a Marriott Hotel! I definately reccomend it to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel in Waikiki.

reviews.title: Don't worry, you'll love it!
reviews.text: The Marriott was totally acceptable but not great. We stayed there the first three nights of our honeymoon and although we were upgraded to one of their more expensive rooms ($470 a night), we found the room to be a little disappointing. The decor was very very green- my husband called it the "chlorophyl room" - definitely needed some updating. It was also pretty small - although very clean and the view of the ocean was nice. I would have been really mad if I had actually paid $470 a night for it though.

We recently stayed at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort for 3 nights and it was fantastic. I did a LOT of research before our travels and decided to go with my gut feeling and choose the Marriott. I've been a long time Marriott customer and previously a business traveler. This hotel was perfect for our family. We had a view of the ocean from our balcony and the rate for the room was very affordable too. We paid $159 per night for partial ocean view. The balcony is small but just what you need and it's really nice to just sit out there and take it all in. The room size was just perfect for me, my husband and 3 year old daughter. We even had my sister in law's family over for one day as they live on the island and that was an additional 2 adults and 2 elementary school aged boys so at one time we even had 7 people (4 adults and 3 kids) and although it would have been tough for sleeping we could all maneuver the room without an issue during the day, showering for dinner, etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Honolulu for preschool age child

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best items I liked about this hotel is that when you get to the beach there is a rocky area in the water that protects part of the beach from bigger waves so if you have a small child who's afraid or just not ready for the waves, this makes it like a perfect pool for them. It also gives you a visual for older children if you want to tell them do not go beyond the rocks. The surfers are a ways out passed the rock ledge. You do have to cross the street to get to the beach but it wasn't far at all from the hotel and very easy to walk the short walk, just one street to go across. There are lots of shopping and restaurants that we walked to from the hotel as we did not rent a car. I would definitely go back to this hotel, it's also quiet there too we had no problems sleeping or hearing noises from neighbors,etc. It's in an area that is quieter rather than smack in the middle of Waikiki but that is exactly what we wanted, convenient enough to walk to the middle of Waikiki but not actually in it while we are trying to relax and sleep. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It was beautiful inside and felt very Hawaiian.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful and even made dinner reservations for me as I forgot to do it before we ran out to catch a van for our day trip to Hanauma Bay. You can catch rides from the hotel to all of the toursit stops on the island, there are fees but they are affordable and saves you the hassle of parking/navigating, etc. Just remember the locals are on local time so they are bit more casual with the time than many of us on the mainland. But it wasn't a huge inconvenience. Just took a little adjustment.
reviews.title: 3* at at 5* price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Experience, highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Second time in Oahu was a pleasant experience!
Nice Place but NOT SAFE
reviews.text: Lots of amenities, including great restaurants. Rooms were nice, but a bit small. Valets were very friendly and helpful, though next time I wouldn't waste my money on valet parking. Concierges were not friendly and not very helpful at all.
Pros:
reviews.title: 2 minute walk to the beach

reviews.text: - location: across the street from the beach
reviews.title: Really nice room

reviews.text: - good service for a busy resort hotel (Buddy the bellman was extremely kind and efficient. My colleague cut his finger and Buddy ran to get bandaids/antiseptic)
reviews.title: Don't pay with frequent flyer miles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - room service delivered a half pineapple for my platinum gift. yum!
reviews.title: good location but average

reviews.text: - w/in walking distance to everything (shopping, dining, etc.)
reviews.title: Frequent travelers should lower their standards, not up to par with regular Marriotts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I drive by this hotel all the time, but had never seen any of the rooms. But, I'm a Marriott frequent stayer so figured I would check it out when I had to stay in Waikiki for a wedding.
reviews.title: Much nicer than expected

reviews.text: The hotel is actually 2 buildings and it is a bit older, but I was very surprised at how well maintained it is. The room was spacious and very modern, the bed was very comfortable, and the view out off the balcony was excellent. The hotel is across the street from the beach (literally a 30 second walk.)
reviews.title: great experience at the Waikiki Beach Marriott

reviews.text: Parking is a bit expensive ($28 per night) and the free Internet was a bit slow, but the hotel was overall a good deal. I searched on Expedia for pricing but ended up getting a better rate by just calling the hotel and asking about availability. This trick does not always work as they sometimes transfer you to their national reservations line.
reviews.title: Bring your own conditioner!
Nice location, good service
reviews.text: My wife and family were attending our son`s wedding at Kahala and we stayed at this hotel, as did our now in laws, who were from Osaka, Japan. Check in was flawless, the service was excellent, the rooms clean and amenities exactly as requested. Our junior suite had a view of Diamond Head from one balcony and the ocean from the other balcony--absolutely beautiful! We hosted a post wedding reception on the Moana Terrace and the food, service and drinks were exceptional--and well priced by Hawwaiian standards. We found all staff to be friendly and effecient from valet parking to checkout. Waikiki Beach is a busy and niosy big city, so if you are planning to leave your patio doors open while you sleep you`re in the wrong hotel. But the location, cleanliness, attention to detail, and other amenities more than made up for the noise.

I stay at the Marriott Waikiki several times a year for business. I have been staying there for 3+ years. I like to earn the Marriott points. There are good things about the hotel, but there are also some annoying things.
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable hotel
Good, not Great Hotel
reviews.text: This is a good, not great hotel, but I feel it's marketing is a bit missleading. First, you should know this location is NOT on the beach, but across the street from it, and odds are your room is not going to have a view of Diamond Head.

reviews.title: Great pool and entertainment!
reviews.text: It's a property that Marriot purchased and refurbished a few years ago. I think the Hotel's original design in the 70's leaves a bit to be desired, so Marriott can only fix up so much. It's located at the northern most end of waikiki so it's a 5 to 10 minute walk to the heart of the beach. If you really want/need to be right on the water check out the Sheraton Moana Surfrider, the Outrigger next door (Dukes), The Royal Hawaiian (older crowd) next to that. Dukes seems to be the epicenter of Waikiki.
The Marriott Waikiki's rooms are standard size (remember built ing the 70's), very comfortable, but nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: best beds in Hawaii
Loved it!
reviews.text: But here's a great tip that Marriot can pay me for later. We missed our flight out and stayed an extra day at the JW Marriott Ihalini on the west side of the island. From the airport the drive time to it is about the same as to the Marriott Waikiki.

reviews.title: Ocean view?
reviews.text: The rooms are amazing!!!! A standard room here was only 30$ more than the standard room at the Marriott Waikiki. I'm 6'4" and the walk from the front door to the end of our lania or our Jr. Suite was 28 paces, they're HUGE. Walk in his and hers closets, 2 tv's, large living area, private lania with chase lounge table and chairs, seperate sinks, shower and tub, 4 large semi private lagoons, pool, marble everything. If your familiar with Las Vegas, these rooms are larger and nicer than the Mandalay, and paired with the view (2/3 face the ocean), truely spectacular. Oh and did I mention that down stairs the fish ponds have manta rays and hammer-head sharks? Hey, I don’t even golf, but if I did they'd probably never get me to leave.

My boyfriend and i decided to go to Hawaii at the very last minute when our hotel was ruined during the hurricane that hit Cancun. We had a lot of trouble trying to find available hotels as it was such a last minute thing but we luckily found this one. We were a little unsure as we had seen many reviews that were not that good . I was finally convinced and booked a Deluxe Ocean View room . On arrival , we could not have asked for anything more . The staff were so friendly to us and helpful that all my worries about the hotel were going away . There was only one more step to go...the hotel room . Our room was located on the 24 floor from what i remember , it was the highest balcony room there. The view was spectacular and the room itself was very very spacious and clean. The only thing , there were a few dirty stains on the curtains but that was nothing when i had a view like this one. The sunset from our balcony was something else ... it was so romantic, beautiful and breath taking all in one.
reviews.title: Great stay!!!
very nice location!
reviews.text: The pool is very small but you spend so much time at the beach that you dont really have time for the pool. We did however eat at the bar which was very nice , the band that was playing was so good .

At the time , there was a large Japanese tourist group and a few sports groups staying at the hotel so going up at down the lift was a long wait . There was about 5 lifts but it still managed to take a long time.
reviews.title: OK stay at the Marriott

reviews.text: The hotel is located across the road from the beach so that was perfect also . Very central to alot of stores so alot of shopping was done. It was about a 5 minute walk to all the fancy stores like Prada , Chanel , Gucci....
reviews.title: Lovely!
Marriott Waikiki Wonderful
reviews.text: There is also a tram a little further down from the hotel that takes you down to the Shopping Mall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with, Waikiki is not my style of beach town. All the shops? Have those at home. Crowded beaches on an island that boasts many secluded ones? Meh.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed this spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But this hotel made my whole experience at Waikiki more enjoyable. It's ever-so-slightly down the street from where the real noise starts and it made a big difference. Was quiet and had a great view of the ocean. Liked that it has two pools close to one another. If one pool was too packed, easy to get to the other. Ate at the Moana Terrace once and got drinks there a few times... solid stuff.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.text: Concierge was very helpful here setting up our Pearl Harbor transportation. Nice to have an ABC store on the property, too, for various items it wasn't practical to fly with.
reviews.title: Outdated rooms, and broken glass on the carpet in our room

reviews.text: Room was well-kept... pretty much the standard Marriott room.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Waikiki
Great Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from Hawaii where we celebrated our 25th Anniversary. This hotel was very clean and a great location. The beach was only a few steps away. Everything you need is right within walking distance such as; stores, restaurants, entertainment, etc... Things are more expensive in Hawaii so be prepared. We rented a car for the day (Hertz is on site) and drove around just about all of Oahu. Waikiki beach is beautiful as well as beaches along the South Shore & Windward side. The Leeward side is not worth the drive. We went to Diamond Head & Pearl Harbor as well. They did a great job with the memorial.

Stayed here one night and I have to say this Marriott is fabulous! I was upgraded to the club level room with a king sized, super comfortable bed, separate living area and 2 blaconies! I cannot say enough about the bed! I sunk into it and didn't want to get out. The location is perfect, the staff were very accomodating (upgraded me without requesting it), and the view of the ocean was very nice. A bit pricy but worth every penny. I would definitely stay here again and recommed it to anyone.
reviews.title: Fabulous!
Great Hotel for the Price and Location
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Waikiki Marriott for 2 nights from May 20-22.

reviews.title: No Regrets
reviews.text: We arrived 3 hours early but our room was ready and we had been upgraded from a city view room to a partial ocean view room.
The lobby was very nice.
reviews.title: Waikiki Marriott met our expectations.

reviews.text: The location was great-just across the street from the beach in the heart of the Waikiki Strip.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an upscale place newer furnishings and decor. We stayed in a two bedroom place and the area around the hotel was small but nice pool and just walk out the front door of the place and you are right on the street for shopping ,restaurants and just a short walk to the beach. This is not a place to just hang out and relax. Get out walk the beach and enjoy the area. There were 6 of us, 3 married couples and with the two baths and three beds lots of room. We didn't use the kitchen ate out for dinner. It was a great location close to many area sites and attractions,could see Diamond Head down the beach. Check it out good place to stay before moving on to another island.Aloha!
reviews.title: Classic View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the location, the marriott itself is good, clean, very friendly staff, pool area is clean and nice. Beware of resort fee, and expensive parking, also, the Kuhio Grill buffet is just OK, you can do better another spots out on the main drag.
reviews.title: Really good hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Net/ net, I've stayed in much nicer marriotts around the country, but none with a much better location!
reviews.title: Very tired hotel - there are much better choices for the price

reviews.text: We stayed here the end of April 2013 when we were re-directed at the end of a 3 week trip through China, Hong Kong, and Hawaii. Having stayed at over 8 hotels across the Pacific, this was by far the worst of the lot.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, the bell men were all standing around their desk chatting and after we arrived at the front desk to check in they decided to approach us to help with the bags. Why did we need their help then? Just to get a tip I'm sure - not to really help us. When we checked out, we needed to check our bags for a few hours - and again, the larger woman at the desk when we arrived back to pick up our bags was busy on her cell phone, was irritated for being interrupted and sauntered over to the closet like we were really bothering her.
reviews.title: Across from the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of a 10-day Oahu trip, our first visit to this island. We ordinarily stay in condos in Hawaii, but wanted to have the Waikiki experience. We chose this hotel because it is close to the quieter end of Waikiki Beach and because of a good review on the website "Oahu Revealed". We requested a high floor (for view and quiet) in the Keohilani Tower when we booked 4 months ago.
reviews.title: Good location and view; mixed service

reviews.text: We arrived at 1pm from the airport, hoping to check in early. The man at the reception desk was very welcoming and told us he could do a "pre-check-in" for an ocean view room with balcony on the 24th floor, as per our request. He said he could check us in at about 2 pm or, if he was busy, any of the other personnel could check us in then.
reviews.title: Breath taking views of Ocean from room

reviews.text: When we returned at 2 pm, he was busy, so we got a female employee. She told us the room was not ready yet, but she could give us a room on the 7th floor. We said we'd wait for the room we had already pre-checked in for. She said to come back at 3 pm.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, ocean across the street.
A pleasant hotel
reviews.text: When we returned at 3, we got the same female employee. She left us waiting for several minutes again, (to see if the room was ready?) When she came back she told us the room on the 24th floor was still not ready, but she could give us a room on the 11th floor. She said the Marriott guarantees check-in at 3 pm but employees aren't supposed to do a pre-check in for a particular room. She gave us a choice of waiting even longer for the room on the 24th floor, or taking the room on the 11th floor. We were pretty travel-weary by then, so we caved and took the room on the 11th floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was probably exactly the same, but we were disappointed that we didn't get the room we were initially promised. Not sure the 24th floor room would have ever been "ready". Room 1104 was a standard hotel room, small bathroom, good shower pressure, plenty of outlets for tech. The balcony was spacious, had decent furniture and a nice view of Waikiki looking southwest. We appreciated having the mini-fridge for the wine we bought in the ABC store downstairs. There was a lot of street noise to be expected in a big city, and we had no way to know if a room on a higher floor would have been quieter.
reviews.title: Anniverary Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights after a few days in Maui before traveling home. We were early checking and they told us we could have a room with no balcony right away or wait several hours for a balcony. As we were only there for 2 nights we decided to skip balcony and just get our room. BIG Mistake! The room was extremely small and it was a view of the top of the parking garage. People were parking and getting in/out of cars right in front of our window. We called and said we wanted a balcony. Sat by the pool (no umbrellas!) until 3 and waited for our new room. They "upgraded" us to a partial ocean view. We could see a sliver of the beach and we over looked the pool of the Aston Waikiki next door. They had music starting at about 6:30 AM every morning for there outdoor breakfast.
reviews.title: Not worth the hassle...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was not clean. Found old sunflower seeds on the floor along with the dirty carpet. We booked a room with a Queen bed but were told none were available and were stuck with 2 doubles which were small to sleep in. Sheets were scratchy and not comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved everything!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking the hotel we were under the impression they had beach access/chairs for the hotel. This was not the case. You had to get towels from the pool and go down to beach (getting glares from towel guy for taking towels away from pool) and then rent chairs from a private company. We were extremely disappointed in this as we wanted to enjoy the beaches and not a pool on the 3rd floor while in Honolulu.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried to avoid having to be at the hotel/in our room at all costs because we were unhappy with it.
reviews.title: Ideal Location!

reviews.text: The day we checked out we had a late flight (8 PM) and went down to front desk night before to request a later check-out as we were doing Pearl Harbor. A manager guy wrote it down and guaranteed that it would not be an issue. The next morning we called again on our way to Pearl Harbor to confirm our late checkout and push it back to 2pm as it was crowded at Pearl Harbor. Again told no problem, just need to get new keys when we returned.
reviews.title: This is not a four star hotel, it is truely a [--]

reviews.text: Spent a week at the Marriott on Waikiki (5/2-5/9) and had a great time! Front Desk was helpful and quick to get us to our room. Lobby had a relaxing, polynesian feel to it (water feature, flowers and music). We had a partial ocean view, which was enough for us. You could see the hills to the right and the ocean to the left. It was windy and chilly at times on the balcony, but we still enjoyed the view. The room was an average size and clean. Everyone is right about the beds! The first thing I did was sit on one to see what all the talk was about. I sunk right into it! Overall no complaints and would love to visit this hotel again!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back to Hawaii!!!

reviews.text: My husband was here on business, and I joined him for 5 days from March 10 -15. What people have said about the beds is true- they have pillowtop mattresses and are incredibly comfortable. We were in the front tower with a nice view of the ocean from our balcony. Additionally, the Resort Quest across the street has live entertainment starting at 7:30 in the morning, and again starting around 6:00 in the evening; you can sit out on your balcony and enjoy the music for free. Being here on business, my husband appreciated the nice desk and internet access. My only complaint was that housekeeping would come somewhere between 11:00- 12:30, and on 2 occasions, I came back from the beach and had to wait about 20 min to get into my room.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay; beach info
Great location
reviews.text: NOW ABOUT THE BEACH... the beach right across from the hotel has a breaker, and is very shallow with no waves. If you go to the right, you end up on a very narrow, very croweded stretch of Waikiki Beach. But, if you go to the left of the pier, you will be on a wonderful, much wider, much less crowded beach with nice waves and very reasonable snorkel and boogie board rentals. They also show free movies here under the stars on Saturday nights.
The WAIKIKI ZOO is a half block away in Kapiolani Park, and the AQUARIUM is a few blocks farther.
reviews.title: Nice, but not ON the beach

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on our last trip to Waikiki and we loved the place and the fact that it was directly opposite to Waikiki Beach. The hotel staff were very helpful in guiding us. Our 4 year old loved it -- every morning we would spend time on the beach with the afternoons reserved for sight seeing. We are Indian and loved eating at India Cafe which is nearby. For all you Indian's out there, a great list of this and other Indian restaurants in Oahu and Hawaii is at http://www.thingsindian.com/hawaii/rhawaii.htm.
reviews.title: Ask for the K Tower!!

reviews.text: We spent six nights at the Marriott Waikiki Beach because my family would be staying there for their visit to Honolulu. My mother used her Marriott Rewards points for her room, and tried booking a room for us, for which they wanted $329 a night for a Partial Ocean View. I contacted the hotel directly, and upon speaking with the very friendly reservations agent, was able to get the Kama'aina (Hawai'i resident) rate of $200 a night for the same category.
reviews.title: It's nice.....and that's about it.

reviews.text: Check-in was very quick and easy. I also found out that parking is only $10 a day with the Kama'aina rates. They fulfilled my request and put us on the same floor as my family in the Paoakalani Tower, room 1256. The room was a little small, with just enough room for a rollaway bed. The double beds were the smallest double beds I'd ever seen in a hotel with barely enough room to fit two adults. The t.v. was a nice flat screen, and there was a desk and two armchairs. The sink was separate from the bathroom, and the room containing the toilet and shower was pretty small too. The lanai was actually quite nice, and quiet well designed: it curved in a way that the one in front of you didn't obstruct your view. We did have a pretty good view of the ocean, and a pretty good view of Diamond Head as well. The beds were comfortable, as was the whole room, even if it was on the boring and bland side. It was very, very clean, though. It looks as if the rooms in the other tower, Kealohilani, are a little more modern in their furnishings.
reviews.title: Great experience at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool areas seemed way too small for a hotel its size, and there was only one hot tub. We visited the Moana Terrace for drinks and snacks, and Sansei Restaurant one evening for dinner; both were pretty good. The parking garage was a complete disaster: very few spots to park, and horribly designed with blind spots and very tight corners. I'm surprised that we didn't witness any accidents. Almost every night we had to valet our car because the garage was full. Fortunately, they don't charge you extra if you only pay for self park. The shops on the ground floor were almost always empty, and there was a slight depressing feeling to them. The staff were all very nice, especially the valets and housekeeping. It may sound funny to say, but one of the best parts of the resort is the elevators. Despite being at full occupancy, we never had to wait more than a minute for one, and they almost were always empty. It was a very efficient system.
reviews.title: Perfect location, right in heart of Waikiki.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is pretty good, on the Diamond Head side of Waikiki. It's a little removed from the action, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing, especially if you don't mind a slight walk. Even if it directly on the beach, it's just across Kalakaua Avenue from Kuhio Beach, which due to the seawall, probably has the calmest waters in Waikiki.
reviews.title: Priceline winners beware, service is poor and rooms are crappy!
Do not stay here! Staff are awful! Stay at The Trump Waikiki instead!
reviews.text: Aside from the parking garage, I really can't fault the Marriott Waikiki Beach, but I really can't overtly compliment it either. It runs well, it gets the job done, and that's about it. The only reason why I stayed here was because of my family visiting, and I probably would of enjoyed myself regardless of my accommodations. I would of been very upset if I had paid $329 for my room, and $200 even seems like too much. A four star rating seems too generous for this resort, for it really doesn't leave a lasting impression. I would rate it 3 and a half if I could, mainly for the staff and the cleanliness. However, for the price, you could do a lot better.

Just returned from an 8 night stay at the Marriott. Overall it was a fabulous place to stay. We got to check in early and had a Deluxe ocean view room that was as close to ocean front as you could get, on the 13th floor in the "K" tower. The view was stunning!!!Room was very nice and beds very comfortable!!!. Bathrooms could stand to be updated, but was nice, toilet was separate from sink and vanity mirror. The only problems we had was they are doing some renovating and loud drilling in the K tower on the 15th and 16th floor, not bad if you are out of your room during the day, but we were in our room for my sons nap time and it was pretty horrible noise. Marriott did compensate me by giving me 30000 marriott points. The only other slight issue with noise was the band from the Moana Terrace grill every night, but they only play til 930 and it is enjoyable when you are sitting on your lanai, but not if you are trying to sleep or watch TV. All in ll it was fabulous and would stay there again for sure!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

likes.liked: — Beach location! Staff very friendly! Close to everything!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the day before the cruise to start off our honeymoon. What a way to start it out! This hotel had the most comfortable bed ever! Between the great view of Diamond Head and the beach, comfortable king size bed, flat screen tv, well decorated, very clean, great service, and location of this hotel it was a great decision to stay here! This hotel is perfect for any NCL cruisers. We checked in the day before which made it worth while the next day. We went right to the Marriott check-in line when we arrived at the port. We couldn't ask for a better hotel to stay at before our cruise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again next time we goto Honolulu. Thank you Marriott for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Great one night stay before the cruise!

likes.liked: — Location and great view from our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the best hotel in Waikiki. The bed is the most comfortable one I've ever slept in. My wife and I had the softest king sized bed ever, with 3 pillows each. The sleep was great. The views were great. We got a city-view room and were able to see the city and the ocean from our balcony. The spa is excellent, the location is great, there is so much to do in and around the hotel. The staff is great. The rooms have nice flat screen lcd televisions, huge bathrooms, and are super clean. Everything about this hotel was top notch. I recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.
reviews.title: Best Hotel In Waikiki

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for 8 nights and had a fantastic time! Across the street from the beach and close to everything was great. We woke up to a view of Diamond Head and the ocean every morning and it doesn't get better than that! Hotel staff were nice and had no problems with service at all. The parking was pricey but convenient so no real complaints about that. Beds were comfortable, shower was good and the fridge in the room was handy. Kids loved the pool (they had a swim before bed every night). We requested a high floor so we didn't hear much street noise. The elevators do take forever which must be a common complaint there because they had notices posted about elevator upgrades starting soon. Another hotel guest and I were laughing about how you could go push the elevator button and then go shower and get ready and then maybe it would be there.
reviews.title: Had a Wonderful Stay!!

reviews.text: We would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!
reviews.title: Served its purpose

description: WAIKIKI BEACH MARRIOTT RESORT & SPA fronts the best stretch of Waikiki Beach. Conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki, the hotel offers 1,310 refurbished guest rooms and suites with private lanai providing spectacular views of world-famous Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. Other amenities include Kuhio Beach Grill, featuring the best in Pacific Rim cuisine; Sansei Seafood Restaurant & Sushi Bar and d.k Steak House; Arancino di Mare Italian Restaurant; newly redesigned Moana Terrace, offering live Hawaiian entertainment nightly; Seattle’s Best Coffee; Paul Brown’s Spa Olakino * Salon; a surf school; two freshwater, heated swimming pools; 10-person whirlpool; new 3,000 sq. ft. 24-hour fitness center; business center with 24-hour Internet access; high-speed and wireless Internet access throughout the resort’s guest rooms and public spaces; shops and boutiques; and Hawaiian cultural activities.
